pageContext.claim: “And as we're negotiating different points the other day in Singapore I asked Chairman Kim would it be possible to do that. The last thing I asked. They said, "Do you mind, because I have many people that have written, and called, and spoken to me, would I be able to get the remains back of all those great heroes that we have from so many years ago." And he said, "I will do that." And you probably read they've already done 200 people, which is so great. So great.”
pageContext.analysis: The remains of 200 U.S. soldiers lost in the Korean War had not been returned when Trump said this.
